result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Lee Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to Probation today (7/13/18) by 10:30 am.

miscConds.notes: $243.00 costs to be paid to Probation. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment.
Must maintain full-time/part-time employment while on probation.

Shall have no contact with SR.
Shall not possess or consume or use drugs or drug paraphernalia or any other illegal substances. Subject to random UA's and PBT's.  
Shall not possess or consume alcohol. Shall not be present in taverns or establishments where the primary business is sale of alcohol. 
Shall only use prescription medications if prescribed by a physician and only in the amounts prescribed.
Eligible for expungment upon successful completion of Probation.  Must petition court.

Must undergo a Domestic Abuse Assessment within 30 days and follow all recommendations for treatment, and complete treatment, including aftercare, successfully. 
Shall cooperate with any evaluation, assessment and/or program as directed by DOC or agent, and complete any recommended treatment successfully. 
Must attend Restorative Justice program. 
Must follow all other rules and regulations required by agent. 
Shall pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
May not possess or use a firearm.

timeConds.notes: Conditional time banked for use by Probation if necessary.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Lee Johnson

DJOC

CASES: 15CM120 & 17CM117. Defendant Steven Lee Johnson in court with attorney Chelsea Anne Whitley.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 9:04 a.m. AO-Clerk. Parties have reached an agreement. 15CM120 judgment will be entered and 17CM117 be dismissed. Ct finds sufficient facts to revoke DJOC and enters conviction for 15CM120. Victims rights complied with. Parties given copy of Injunction in 15CV147. 

SENTENCE:

i/s 18 mo WPS, 1 year probation and 6 months conditional JT stayed for use of probation; must attend domestic abuse assessment & comply with recommended treatment; comply with recommendations of probation; cannot possess or consume alcohol or drugs or be in any bars or taverns, no possession of paraphernalia, may not possess firearms, no contact order remains in effect, must attend restorative justice program, must get a job. Must sign up at probation today by 10:30 a.m., follow rules of probation. 

Eligible for expungement. State to give restitution owed figure w/in 30 days.
